gurmukhi: cil cMd muKI hir ky iFg qy biRKBwn suqw pih pY cil AweI ] Awie kY AYsy khXo iqh so bl byg clo nMdlwl bulweI ]
transliteration: Chal(i) Channd Moukhihar(i) Ke Dhig Te Brikhbhaan Soutaa Pah(i) Pai Chal(i) Aaee|| Ooe Kai Aise Kahyo Tih So Bal Beg Chalo Naandlaal Bulaaee||
translation: That moon-faced gopi, leaving Krishna, reached near Radha; she said on coming, “Go quickly, the son Nand has called you.

gurmukhi: mY n clo hir pwh hhw clu AYsy khXo n kro duicqweI ] kwhy ko bYT rhI ieh Taur mY mohn ko mno ic`qu curweI ]697]
transliteration: Mai Na Chalo Har(i) Paah Hahaa Chal(u) Aise Kahyo Na Daro Douchitaaee|| Kaahe Ko Baith Rahieh Tharu Mai Mohan Ko Mano Chitt(u) Chadhaaee||697||
translation: “Why did you say that you would not go to Krishna? Leave this duality. Why are you sitting at this place on stealing the heart of charming Krishna?”697.

gurmukhi: ijh Gor Gtw Gn Awey GnY chU Ern mY jh mor pukwrY ] nwcq hY jh gÍwrnIXw iqh pyiK Gno ibrhI qn vwrY ]
transliteration: Jih Ghor Ghataa Ghan Aae Ghanai Chahoo Oran Mai Jah Mor Poukdarai|| Naachat Hai Jah Gvaarneeyaa Tih Pekh(i) Ghano Bir Hitan Vdarai||
translation: “When the thundering clouds spread, the peacocks shout on all the four sides, the gopis dance and the love-sick people offer themselves as sacrifice,

gurmukhi: qaun smY jdurwie suno murlI ko bjwie kY qoih icqwrY ] qwhI qy byg clo sjnI iqh kauqk koN hm jwie inhwrY ]698]
transliteration: Taoun Samai Jaduraaae Souno Murliko Bajaae Kai Tohe Chitdarai|| Taahite Beg Chalo Sajnitih Kaoutak Kon Ham Jaae Nihdarai||698||
translation: “At that time, O friend ! listen, Krishna, playing on his flute remembers you; O friend ! go quickly so that on reaching there we may be able to see the wonderful sport.”698.

gurmukhi: qw qy n mwn kro sjnI hir pws clo nih SMk ibcwro ] bwq Dro rs hUM kI mnY Apny mn mY n kCU hT Dwro ]
transliteration: Taa Te Na Maan Daro Sajnidar(i) Paas Chalo Nah(i) Shank Bicdaro|| Baat Ddaro Ras Hoon Kimanai Apne Man Mai Na Kacdhoodhath Ddaro||
translation: “Therefore, O friend! forsaking you pride, abandon your doubts and go to Krishna; fill your mind with passion and do not involve yourself in persistence.”

gurmukhi: kauqk kwnH ko dyKn ko iqh ko js pY kib sXwm aucwro ] kwhy kau bYT rhI hT kY khXo dyKn kau aumgXo mn swro ]699]
transliteration: Kaoutak Kaahn Ko Dekhan Ko Tih Ko Jas Pai Kabi Syaam Oucdaro|| Kaahe Kau Baith Rahihath Kai Kahyo Dekhan Kau Oumgyo Man Daro||699||
translation: The poet Shyam says that with out seeing the amorous sport of Krishna, why do you persist in sitting here? My mind is eager to see his amorous sport.699.

gurmukhi: hir pws n mY clho sjnI ipKby khu kauqk jIX n myro ] sXwm rcy sMg Aaur qRIXw qj kY hm so Pun nyh Gnyho ]
transliteration: Har(i) Paas Na Mai Chal-ho Sajanipikhbe Kauh Kaoutak Jeeya Na Mero|| Syaam Rache San Aur Treeyaa Taj Kai Ham So Phoun Neh Ghanero||
translation: Radha said, “O friend! I shall not go to Krishna and I have no desire to see his amorous sport; Krishna has forsaken his love with me and is absorbed in the love of other women;

gurmukhi: cMdRBgw hUM sMg khXo nih nwrI khw muih nYnn hyro ] qwqy n pws clo hir hau auiT jwih joaU aumgXo mn qyro ]700]
transliteration: Channdrabhagad Hoon Ke San Kahyo Nah(i) Naarikahyaa Oumhe Mainan Hero|| Tate Na Paas Chalo9 Har(i) Hau Outh(i) Jaah(i) Jooo Oumgyo Man Tero||700||
translation: “He is absorbed in love with Chandarbhaga and does not even see me with his eyes; therefore inspite of the upthrust of your mind, I shall not go to Krishna.”700.

gurmukhi: mY khw dyKn jwau qRIXw quih lXwvn ko jdurwie pTweI ] qwhI qy hua sB gÍwrin qy auT kY qb hI qumry pih AweI ]
transliteration: Mai Khaaa Dekhan Jaao Triyaa Tuhe Lyaavan Ko Jaduraae Pathaaee|| Taahite Hau Sabh Gvaaran(i) Te Outh Kai Tab Hitoumre Pah(i) Aaee||
translation: “Why should I go to see the women? Krishna has sent me to bring you; therefore, I, keeping away from all the gopis, have come to you;
